bioghist.p: The first formal meeting of the Pennsylvania Bible Society was held on December 12, 1808. The first president was Bishop William White and the first Vice President was Dr. Benjamin Rush, signer of the Declaration of Independence. In 1812, the Society, now known as the Bible Society of Philadelphia published the first Bible printed in the U.S. from Stereotype plates. In 1840, the Bible Society of Philadelphia became the Pennsylvania Bible Society. The mission of the Pennsylvania Bible Society is to "distribute Holy Scripture without note or comment to all who want to hear it, at an affordable price, or free of charge to those unable to pay".

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of minutes of the Pennsylvania Bible Society, 1808-1819, including a 1963 typed transcription of minutes, 1812-1819 (3 vols.); Executive Committee minutes, 1827-1830 and 1836-1843 (3 volumes); and Distribution Committee minutes, 1842-1876 (2 volumes). The minutes are monthly (and in some cases semimonthly) and include reports on the distribution of bibles, reports of committees, financial statements, discussion of interactions with other Bible Societies, and discussions of printing and publication matters. The collection also includes minutes of the Philadelphia Young Men's Bible Society, 1842-1854.
